sen.j: 興福院（こんぶいん）は、奈良県奈良市法蓮町にある浄土宗の尼寺。
sen.e: Konbu-in Temple is a Jodo (Pure Land) sect nunnery temple located in Horen-cho, Nara City, Nara prefecture.
Konbu-in Temple is a Jodo (Pure Land) sect nunnery temple located in Horen-cho, Nara City, Nara prefecture.
Konbu-in Temple is a Jodo (Pure Land) sect nunnery temple located in Horen-cho, Nara City, Nara prefecture.

sen.j: 山号を法蓮山と称する。
sen.e: It is called Horensan as its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple.
Its sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Horen-san
sen.cmt: 構文を変えました。山号： sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple→sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) Horensan→Horen-san
sen.e: Its sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Horen-san

sen.j: 本尊は阿弥陀如来、開基（創立者）は和気清麻呂ともいい、藤原百川ともいう。
sen.e: Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), and its Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)is said to be WAKE no Kiyomaro or FUJIWARA no Momokawa.
Its honzon (principal image) is Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), and its Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)is said to be WAKE no Kiyomaro or FUJIWARA no Momokawa.
Its honzon (principal image) is Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), and its Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)is said to be WAKE no Kiyomaro or FUJIWARA no Momokawa.

sen.j: 興福院の創建については複数の説があり、中世以前の沿革はあまり明らかでない。
sen.e: There are divided opinions over the founding of Kombu-in Temple, and its history before the Medieval Period is not known in details.
There are divided opinions over the founding of Konbu-in Temple, and its history before the medieval times is not known in details.
There are divided opinions over the founding of Konbu-in Temple, and its history before the medieval times is not known in details.

sen.j: 寺伝では天平の頃、和気清麻呂が学問所として創建した弘文院が前身という。
sen.e: Its temple history says that it was originally Kobun-in, which was established by WAKE no Kiyomaro as an academic temple around the Tenpyo era.
Its temple history says that it was originally called Kobun-in, which was established by WAKE no Kiyomaro around the Tenpyo era as an academic facility.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Its temple history says that it was originally called Kobun-in, which was established by WAKE no Kiyomaro around the Tenpyo era as an academic facility.

sen.j: また、「諸寺縁起集」などの史料には藤原百川が創建した興福尼院が前身とされている。
sen.e: Historical materials such as "Shoji Engi Shu" (The book describing the history of every temple) says that it was originally Kombu-nyoin established by FUJIWARA no Momokawa.

On the other hand, some historical materials such as "Shoji Engi Shu" (The book describing the history of every temple) says that it was originally a nunnery Konbuni-in established by FUJIWARA no Momokawa.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, some historical materials such as "Shoji Engi Shu" (The book describing the history of every temple) says that it was originally a nunnery Konbuni-in established by FUJIWARA no Momokawa.

sen.j: なお、本尊の阿弥陀三尊像が奈良時代の作品であることから、寺の創建も奈良時代にさかのぼると思われる。
sen.e: Additionally, its honzon, Amida Sanzon-zo was a work during the Nara Period, suggesting that the founding of the temple goes back to the Nara period.
Additionally, its principal image, the statue of Amida Sanzon, was a work in the Nara period, and this suggests that the foundation of the temple goes back to the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Additionally, its principal image, the statue of Amida Sanzon, was a work in the Nara period, and this suggests that the foundation of the temple goes back to the Nara period.

sen.j: 寺はもと添上郡興福院村（近鉄尼ヶ辻駅近く）にあった。
sen.e: The temple was originally close to Kombu-in Village in Soekami district (near Kintetsu Amagatsuji Station).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The temple was originally located in the vicinity of Konbuin-mura Village in Soekami Country, Yamato Province (near present Kintetsu Amagatsuji Station).
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: The temple was originally located in the vicinity of Konbuin-mura Village in Soekami Country, Yamato Province (near present Kintetsu Amagatsuji Station).

sen.j: 徳川家綱代の（寛文5年（1665年））に現在地の法蓮町に移転し、尼寺として再興された。
sen.e: During the reign of Ietsuna TOKUGAWAIt (1665), it was moved to Horen-cho, the place where it is staying at present, and revived as a nunnery temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the reign of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA (1665), it was moved to the present site Horen-cho, and restored as a nunnery temple.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: During the reign of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA (1665), it was moved to the present site Horen-cho, and restored as a nunnery temple.

sen.j: 第2世の尼僧は、元大和郡山城主豊臣秀長の未亡人。
sen.e: The second generation nun was the widow of Hidenaga TOYOTOMI, former Lord of Yamatokoriyama Castle.
The second priestess was the widow of Hidenaga TOYOTOMI, former Lord of Yamato Koriyama Castle.
sen.cmt: The second generation nun →The second priestess
sen.e: The second priestess was the widow of Hidenaga TOYOTOMI, former Lord of Yamato Koriyama Castle.

sen.j: 3代徳川家光から14代徳川家茂までの将軍の位牌をまつっている。
sen.e: It enshrines ihai (ancestral tablets) of Shogun from Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun to Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun.
It enshrines ihai (mortuary tablets) of shoguns from the third Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA to the 14th Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 序数表記は、9までは書き下し、10以上は算用数字+thとしました。
sen.e: It enshrines ihai (mortuary tablets) of shoguns from the third Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA to the 14th Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.

tit.cmt: 以下の説明に合わせ、Complexを使いました。

sen.j: 大門から抜けた庭（小堀遠州作）の先、中門の奥に本堂がある。
sen.e: Its main hall is ahead of a garden leading from Daimon-gate (the great outer gate) and at the back of chumon (inner gate).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hondo (main hall) is located at the back of chumon (inner gate), the gate situated behind the garden (designed by Enshu KOBORI) that can be reached from Daimon-gate (the great outer gate).
sen.cmt: 構文変更しました。訳漏れ：（小堀遠州作）→ (designed by Enshu KOBORI) としました。
sen.e: The hondo (main hall) is located at the back of the chumon (inner gate) which is situated past the garden through the Daimon-gate (the great outer gate).
sen.cmt: the gate situated behind the garden (designed by Enshu KOBORI) that can be reached from Daimon-gate →which is situated past the garden through the Daimon-gate

sen.j: 本堂と渡り廊下で結ばれた客殿がある。
sen.e: Its kyakuden (guest hall) was connected with the main hall via the connecting corridor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kyakuden (guest hall) is connected with the main hall via the connecting corridor.
Kyakuden (guest hall) is connected with the main hall via the connecting corridor.

sen.j: 客殿 - 重要文化財。
sen.e: kyakuden (guest hall) - important cultural property
Kyakuden (guest hall) - Important Cultural Property
sen.cmt: Kyakuden (guest hall) - Important Cultural Propertyとしました。
sen.e: Kyakuden (guest hall) - Important Cultural Property

sen.j: 江戸時代、寛永年間頃に建てられた、入母屋造り瓦葺の建物。
sen.e: Built around Kanei era in the Edo Period, the hall is an irimoya-zukuri construction (a hip-and-gable roof construction, or a building with this roof construction) with a tiled roof.
Built around Kanei era in the Edo Period, the hall is an irimoya-zukuri construction (a hip-and-gable roof construction, or a building with this roof construction) with a tiled roof.
Built around Kanei era in the Edo Period, the hall is an irimoya-zukuri construction (a hip-and-gable roof construction, or a building with this roof construction) with a tiled roof.

sen.j: 檜皮葺きの玄関が付属する。
sen.e: It has an entrance with a roof covered with bark of Japanese cypress.
It has an entrance with a roof covered with bark of Japanese cypress.
It has an entrance with a roof covered with bark of Japanese cypress.

sen.j: 大門 - 奈良県指定文化財。
sen.e: Daimon-gate (the great outer gate) - a cultural property designated by Nara prefecture
Daimon gate (the great outer gate) - Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefecture
sen.cmt: Daimon gate (the great outer gate) - Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefectureとしました。
sen.e: Daimon gate (the great outer gate) - Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefecture

sen.j: （寛永頃）
sen.e: (built around Kanei era)
(built around Kanei era)
(built around Kanei era)

sen.j: 本堂 - 奈良県指定文化財。
sen.e: Main hall - a cultural property designated by Nara prefecture

sen.cmt: Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefectureとしました。

(built 1642)
(built 1642)

sen.j: 客殿（附玄関）
sen.e: kyakuden (tsuketari entrance)
Kyakuden (the entrance is classified as Tsuketari [undesignated attached architecture])
sen.cmt: (tsuketari entrance)→(the entrance is classified as Tsuketari [undesignated attached architecture])
sen.e: Kyakuden (the entrance is classified as Tsuketari [undesignated attached architecture])

sen.j: 乾漆阿弥陀三尊像－当寺の本尊。
sen.e: Dry-lacquered Amida Sanzon-zo (the image [figure, statue] of Amida Triad) - the principal image of the temple
Dry-lacquered statue of Amida Sanzon (Amida Triad) - the principal image of the temple
sen.cmt: Dry‐lacquered statue of Amida Sanzon (Amida Triad)としました。

sen.j: 木心乾漆造。
sen.e: Mokushin kanshitsu-zukuri (wood-core dry lacquer
Mokushin kanshitsu-zukuri method (wood-core dry lacquer)
Mokushin kanshitsu-zukuri method (wood-core dry lacquer)

sen.j: 奈良時代の作。
sen.e: It is a work of the Nara Period.
It is a work made in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: It is a work made in the Nara Period.
sen.e: It is a work made in the Nara Period.

sen.j: ただし、表面の漆箔は江戸期の補修である。
sen.e: However its surface lacquered leaf was repaired during the Edo Period.
However, its surface lacquered leaf shows that it was repaired in the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: However, its surface lacquered leaf shows that it was repaired in the Edo Period.

sen.j: 脇侍の観音菩薩像・勢至菩薩像は半跏像。
sen.e: Its kyoji (attendant figures), statues of Kannon and Seji bosatsu are half lotus positioned.
Its attendant statues, Kannon Bosatsu and Seji Bosatsu are half lotus positioned.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Its attendant statues, Kannon Bosatsu and Seji Bosatsu are half lotus positioned.

sen.j: 刺繍袱紗（ししゅうふくさ）31枚 －徳川綱吉の側室・瑞春院の寄進。
sen.e: 31 items of embroidery fukusa (napkin) - donated by Zuishunin, a concubine of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA
31 items of embroidery fukusa (small silk wrapper) - donated by Zuishunin, a concubine of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA
31 items of embroidery fukusa (small silk wrapper) - donated by Zuishunin, a concubine of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA

sen.j: 縦横とも50cmほどの大きさがあり、盆などに掛ける掛袱紗である。
sen.e: A hanged fukusa used in Obon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Souls' Day) is 50 cm long and wide.
This fukusa is a 50 cm square hanging wrapper used in Obon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Souls' Day).
sen.cmt: 一部訳を変更しました。
sen.e: This fukusa is a 50 cm square hanging wrapper used in Obon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Souls' Day).

sen.j: 絹本著色阿弥陀二十五菩薩来迎図
sen.e: Amida Nijugo Bosatsu Raigozu (Descent of Amida and Twenty-Five Attendants) colored on silk canvas

sen.j: 古葉略類聚鈔
sen.e: Kobaryaku Ruijusho

sen.cmt: 古葉略類聚鈔：Kobaryaku Ruijusho (a transcription compiled in the Kamakura period of the oldest Japanese poetry collection, "Manyoshu")NC_chek: the order of the words in the part marked in read

sen.cmt: Neilさん、語順なのですが、compiledが"Manyoshu"にかからないようにコンマをつけました。

sen.j: 近鉄奈良線近鉄奈良駅から奈良交通バス「自衛隊前」「西大寺」行き（法華寺経由）で9分
sen.e: It is 9 minute ride of bus of Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd. bound for "Jieitai-mae" or "Saidai-ji" (via Hokke-ji) away from Kintetsu Nara Line Nara Station.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From Nara Station (Kintetsu Nara Line) 9 minute-ride on a bus (Nara Kotsu Bus Lines) bound for 'Jieitai-mae' or 'Saidai-ji' via Hokke-ji Temple.

sen.j: 「佐保小学校前」下車、徒歩5分
sen.e: It is then 5 minute walk from the bus stop "Sasebo shogakko-mae. "
